name: San Diego Padres Quiz | San Diego Padres | 15 Questions

questions.text: What year did the Padres join the NL?
questions.explanation:
1969.

	The Montreal Expos joined the NL that same year.

questions.text: In what city did the Padres AAA team play in 2003?
questions.explanation:
Portland.

	The team was called the Beavers in 2003. The Padres former AAA team was located in Las Vegas until 2000. Las Vegas was later the AAA affilate of the Dodgers. The Padres had their AA team in Mobile.

questions.text: What year did the Padres' stadium open?
questions.explanation:
1967.

	The stadium, now called Qualcomm, was originally called San Diego Stadium and was home to the NFL's Chargers. The Padres moved in 2 years later when they became a NL expansion team. A new Padres stadium is currently under construction in Downtown San Diego, and is due to open in 2004. In honor of Tony Gwynn, the stadium will be located at 19 Tony Gwynn Drive.

questions.text: Which of these player's numbers has not been retired by the Padres?
questions.explanation:
Rollie Fingers.

	The numbers that have been retired are: 6 (Garvey), 31 (Winfield), and 35 (Jones). The Padres are likely to soon retire Tony Gwynn's no. 19.

questions.text: What is behind the outfield wall at Qualcomm Stadium?
Which former Padre player was known as 'Mr. Padre'?
Who was the first former Padre in their minor league system to be inducted into the Hall Of Fame?
questions.explanation:
Ted Williams.

	He played for the Padres when they were a Minor League team. There is a street in San Diego named after him. (Ted Williams Parkway)

questions.text: What year did the Padres change their colors?
questions.explanation:
1992.

	The old colors of brown and orange were thought to be to drab. They changed to navy, orange and white.

questions.text: Ray Kroc, the former owner of McDonalds, bought the Padres in 1974 just as they were ready to relocate to what city?
Who was the first Padres' pitcher to win the Cy Young Award?
questions.explanation:
Randy Jones.

	He recieved the award on December 16, 1976 after posting a 22-14 season in which he sets club records for wins, innings pitched and complete games. Butch Metzger was named N.L. Rookie Pitcher of the Year.

questions.text: Who was the first Padres manager?
As a Padres player, what position did manager Bruce Bochy play?
questions.explanation:
Catcher.

	He was born in France. He became Padres manager in 1994, replacing Jim Riggleman. Prior to that, he was the 3rd base coach.

questions.text: What do the Padres have as their mascot?
questions.explanation:
swinging friar.

	The team's nickname is the Friars... Qualcomm Stadium is located on Friars Road. The chicken was used in the 70's.

questions.text: Who was the Padres' first draft choice when they joined the National League?
questions.explanation:
Ollie Brown.

	The Padres drafted him on October 14, 1968. He was the first player out of 30 to be selected.

questions.text: The Padres were the first team to play a series outside the US or Canada. Where did they play?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	The series, 'La Primera Serie' was played August 16-18, 1996 against The New York Mets in Monterrey.
